title: Baby boy plays with 'loaded Glock' as dad films in chilling video

An Israeli man arrested for firearm offences was later found to have filmed a horrifying video of his baby son playing with what appeared to be a loaded Glock on his mobile phone.

The 18-month old can be seen holding the weapon - which the man claims is a replica - like it is a child's toy as he sits in his cot during an astonishing clip released by the force.

The man - not named by police - was taken in for other gun offences and had his mobile phone examined by officers.

He was illegally selling firearms, according to Hebrew media reports.

It was then that they made a shocking discovery - the baby boy playing with the alleged pistol as the parent filmed it on his mobile.

They found other images which showed bullets scattered around his crib.

Police officials have confirmed that they have also now charged him with endangering his son's life, The Times of Israel report.

The man's legal adviser claims the gun was a replica.

“My client denies all that is attributed to him in the indictment,” an attorney told Channel 13.

Arab-Israelis have recently protested against increasing crime levels in the town.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Yousef Jabarin, an Arabic Member of the Knesset and resident of Umm al-Fahm, told the Jerusalem Post: "We recently cautioned against the severity of the situation and the lack of security in Arabic towns, but unfortunately the bloodbath persists.

"The Arabic residents have had enough of criminals enjoying full autonomy in their towns, and they continue striking without judgement of repercussions."
description: WARNING - DISTRESSING CONTENT: The jaw-dropping footage was found on his father's phone after police examined the device in Israel
